title: Wasudev Waman Patankar
text:
Wasudev Waman Patankar (Marathi: वासुदेव वामन पाटणकर; 29 December 1908 – 20 June 1997), popularly known by the name Bhausaheb Patankar (Marathi: भाऊसाहेब पाटणकर), was a prominent Marathi <a href="shayar%20%28poet%29">shayar</a>, and one of the first to pen <a href="Marathi%20language">Marathi</a> <a href="shayari">shayari</a>, until then Shayari was an outcome of <a href="Urdu">Urdu</a> language.
W.W Patankar was an Advocate by profession.
Life.
Bhausaheb was born as Wasudev Waman Patankar on 29 December 1908. Wasudev's father Waman Patankar was a school headmaster at <a href="Achalpur">Achalpur</a>.(<a href="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a>). Patankar studied <a href="Vedas">Vedas</a>, <a href="philosophy">philosophy</a> and other <a href="shastra">shastra</a>s as a <a href="shishya">shishya</a> under Sitaramshastri Kurumbhatte. In later years he completed his graduation in <a href="arts">arts</a> and further in <a href="law">law</a> and worked as a full-time <a href="advocate">advocate</a> at <a href="Yavatmal">Yavatmal</a> District court from 1933 to 1959,because of his profession he used to deal with lot of villagers as clients and was tempted to jungle life, he took hunting lessons from his <a href="guru">guru</a> Baburao Naidu. He had a licensed <a href="Winchester%20Model%201895">Winchester Model 1895</a> (hunting cartridge <a href=".405%20Winchester">.405 Winchester</a>) rifle and had an official games license, which he used for hunting tigers, the speciality of his hunting was that never hunted the tiger sitting on a hunting platform or a tree stand as he believed in doing it face to face his observing nature can be seen from the observations he had on nature and its happenings, he wrote a series of such observations in "Amrut" magazine from 1952 to 1956.
He retired due to eyesight problems.
Writing style.
After getting into <a href="Urdu">Urdu</a> shayari he wanted to pen its independent Marathi version He started with <a href="Marathi%20language">Marathi</a> <a href="shayari">shayari</a> at the age of 52 and his writing style clearly depicts his young heartedness and happy go lucky nature. With lucid and subtle use of words in his shayari large number of people relished it from beginning. His Marathi shayari in the initial stage was tending to <a href="humour">humour</a> and <a href="Romance%20%28love%29">romance</a> but as he studied deep his shayari touched all the subjects from romance to various aspects of <a href="life">life</a> and <a href="philosophy">philosophy</a>. Later Many Marathi shayars were inspired to present programmes of Marathi shayari.
Awards.
Late Bhausaheb Patankar Memorial Award given by Rangat Sangat Pratishthan is awarded in recognition to the contribution in the field of shayari.
